user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I loved this product, but I recommend it only when absolutely necessary. I live in Texas and the hot summers mean that most blush doesn't last past the walk to my car in the morning. The liquid blush is the first I have found that will hold up to the heat and last the majority of the day. A little definitely goes a long way; I use only half a pump or less for both cheeks, and even then I have to blend it out significantly on my hand before applying it. It has a longer dry down time as well, so I have to avoid touching my face or using other products for a few minutes after applying. While I love the color and staying power, the complicated application process is not always worth it. I really only reach for this product if I know I will not be able to reapply my blush at a later point in the day.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
This blush (in color Torrid; site wouldn’t let me change color) is gorgeous; a little goes a long way and it looks somewhat orangey going on, but blends out to be a gorgeous coral, even on my cool, fair skin. Lovely color for summer to match a more bronzer makeup look. A tiny dab is all I need, and the glow stays for hours. HOWEVER, the packaging is awful. Something about the bottle being square doesn’t allow it to screw closed tightly, and I was devastated to see after having it just a couple of weeks that it spilled all over my makeup drawer recently. That’s an expensive blush to spill for crappy packaging! I should’ve known to store it upright when I noticed the sample bottle in-store had drips all over it. So very disappointed. Proceed with caution and make sure to store this upright and do not travel with it!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
This blush is definitely a high end price but I still haven't run out of product after a long while. This shade is described as a matte dusty rose but I don't find that true because you can see fine shimmer particles on the skin but it looks nice. A little goes a long way since it's very pigmented and it's lasted through very humid and hot weather. I would recommend powdering it for longer staying power but I have been able to wear this throughout all four seasons. There are definitely more affordable liquid blushes that have a great formula as this but this product will last you a very long time. I find it looks best on bare skin or with a little bit of makeup under.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: requires practice but well worth the effort...
review_content:
I love the color of this liquid blush. NARS really does offer quality products for a reasonable price particularly when compared to other brands. I bought dolce vita, a dusty rose color that compliments my olive skin tone well. The color payoff is fantastic almost too good for my lack of application skills. Lol That is the only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5. The product is a bit runny which makes it difficult to apply especially since I’m not that skilled. The product also sets very quickly so there is little room for error or correction. That being said if & when you get the application just right it is definitely worth the effort. It looks phenomenal & has saying power unlike powder blushes. I am over 40 & recently decided to move away from powder products as they tend to age me by settling into not so fine lines.

review_content: I never thought I would use liquid blush and then I swatched this in the store and I was shook. I like the original powder blush in Orgasm and to my surprise, I like the liquid version even more. A little goes a long way with this product, and can easily be blended with clean fingertips. user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I purchased both Orgasm and Torrid and found that both colours suited my light complexion. I had some issues with application as in deciding the best way to apply. I finally settled on using a brush because finger application didn't produce an even wash of colour, I just ended up with blotches of colour on my cheeks. Three stars taken away because of the terrible packaging. So much product was wasted because the pump dispenses with barely any pressure, using an index finger to pump, you end up with three times the amount of product that you actually need. The lids of both bottles never stayed on and when they constantly fell off in my makeup bag, the pump would hit something like a makeup brush or an eyeshadow pallet and liquid would end up all over the inside of my makeup bag. It was a mess! You would think for the cost of this item NARS could at least invest in some quality packaging, not the cheap bottles these liquid blushes come in. I wouldn't purchase again unless the packaging changed. Washing my makeup bag and cleaning every item in that bag, over and over, got old, fast.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: so beautiful but application is tricky
review_content:
I love liquid and créme blushes and NARS always give you a lot of product for the money. When I apply this with my fingers or a sponge it always messes up my foundation. I’ve found the best method is to put a tiny drop on the back of your hand then pick up most the product with a fluffy but small synthetic brush like the colourpop f5. The brush has to be pretty saturated. Then you barely skim and feather the product on your cheeks. The finished effect is so stunning and skin-like and it’s very easy to layer for stronger flushed look. NARS, please make these in more shades! Like Lovejoy or Madly?!? PS Torrid is the perfect sunburn color for medium to tan olive skin tones!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: amazing, but theres a learning curve
review_content:
the perfect "I spent the day in the sun and now I have the perfect glow" shade! my holy grail. I have very dry skin and this did not cling to any dry patches, it just made me look healthy! I wish Nars would come out with a bronzer and/or contour in this formula! Only issue is its incredibly pigmented so I put a half a pump on a makeup palette (I actually use a mason jar lid cause I'm cheap) and tap it into my beauty blender, then once its absorbed I tap it a few more times to distribute the product better before I put it on my cheeks. I would also recommend using a separate makeup sponge dedicated to this blush as its incredibly pigmented and if you dont wash it out reaaaally well after every single use it could easily mess up your foundation if you use the same sponge for it

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_title: Product is A ; packaging is complete trash, someho
review_content:
Product itself is great, and the color suits my skin tone perfectly. That's why it gets anything above 1 star. This would get one star otherwise, due to packaging. I have no idea what happened, but at some point the cap decided it didn't want to couple with the glass container anymore. It simply refuses to go on in a manner that actually closes the container. Because of this ridiculous issue, it made an absolutely monstrous mess which was luckily contained in a plastic bag, since I had it on the plane. I thought "well shoot, maybe the pressure screwed with the formula and it leaked." Nope! It's the cap. Now I have half a container of this product (which I've used so little of that you couldn't even tell it was used by looking at the liquid level), blush all over the outside of this product and a ton of my other makeup products, and the cap won't even go on so I can close it. This is such an asinine issue for an expensive, famous makeup product to have.
